document.heading: Child and Youth, Safety and Health Omnibus Temporary Amendment Act of 2004

history.narrative: Law 15-117, the “Child and Youth, Safety and Health Omnibus Temporary Amendment Act of 2004”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 15-589, and was retained by Council. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 2, 2003, and January 6, 2004, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 27, 2004, it was assigned Act No. 15-304 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 15-117 became effective on March 30, 2004.
